I have no time at all.
We'll see each other again sometime.

example_de: Meine Brille muss hier irgendwo sein.
example_en: My glasses must be here somewhere.

example_de: Warst du jemals in den USA?
example_en: Have you ever been to the USA?

example_de: Mittags esse ich in der Kantine.
example_en: At noon I eat in the canteen.
At night all cats are gray (proverb).

example_de: Ich kann nicht kommen, ich bin nämlich krank.
example_en: I can't come, you see I'm sick.
usage_notes: Used to provide a reason, but doesn't change word order.

example_de: Ich kann meine Schlüssel nirgends finden.
example_en: I can't find my keys anywhere.

example_de: Ich gehe spazieren, obwohl es regnet.
example_en: I'm going for a walk although it's raining.
usage_notes: Subordinating conjunction (kicks verb to the end).

example_de: Beeil dich, sonst verpassen wir den Zug.
example_en: Hurry up, otherwise we'll miss the train.
usage_notes: Inverts subject and verb: `sonst verpassen wir...`

example_en: He's taking tea instead of coffee.
usage_notes: Often used with dative in spoken German, but genitive is formally correct.

example_de: Trotz des Regens gehen wir spazieren.
example_en: Despite the rain, we're going for a walk.
usage_notes: Often used with dative in spoken German.

example_de: Übrigens, ich habe den Job bekommen.
example_en: By the way, I got the job.
You definitely have to see that.

example_de: Ich bin unterwegs und komme in 10 Minuten.
example_en: I'm on the way and will arrive in 10 minutes.
I have no idea at all.

example_de: Mir gefällt vor allem die Farbe.
Das hättest du mir vorher sagen sollen.
example_en: You should have told me that beforehand.

example_de: Ich mag weder Fisch noch Fleisch.
example_en: I like neither fish nor meat.
Lastly, I would like to say thank you.

example_de: Sie ist seit fünf Jahren verwitwet.
example_en: She has been widowed for five years.
I would like to eat something.
usage_notes: Often shortened to `was` in spoken German.
Takes adjective endings based on the noun's gender/case.

cultural_note: they can also stand alone as pronouns.

example_de: Wem hast du das Buch gegeben?
example_en: To whom did you give the book?

usage_notes: Asks for the genitive object. (Advanced A2/B1).

example_de: Ich putze meine Zähne, bevor ich ins Bett gehe.
example_en: I brush my teeth before I go to bed.

example_de: Während ich koche, höre ich Musik.
example_en: While I cook, I listen to music.
usage_notes: Subordinating conjunction. Can also be a genitive preposition.

example_de: Seitdem er in Berlin wohnt, ist er glücklicher.
example_en: Since he has lived in Berlin, he is happier.

example_de: Als ich ein Kind war, lebte ich in Hamburg.
example_en: When I was a child, I lived in Hamburg.
usage_notes: Used for a specific point or period in the past. Not to be confused with `wenn`.

example_de: Wenn es regnet, bleibe ich zu Hause.
example_en: If it rains, I stay home.
usage_notes: Used for conditions and repeated or future events.

example_de: Ich weiß nicht, ob er kommt.
example_en: I don't know if he is coming.

example_de: Er spricht langsam, sodass ich ihn verstehe.
example_en: He speaks slowly so that I understand him.

example_de: Ich gebe dir Geld, damit du das Ticket kaufen kannst.
example_en: I'm giving you money so that you can buy the ticket.

example_de: Du kannst entweder Tee oder Kaffee haben.
example_en: You can have either tea or coffee.

example_de: Er isst weder Fleisch noch Fisch.
example_en: He eats neither meat nor fish.

example_de: Der Film ist zwar lang, aber sehr gut.
example_en: Admittedly the film is long, but very good.

example_de: Ich mag sowohl Hunde als auch Katzen.
example_en: I like both dogs and cats.

example_de: Der Bus kommt in fünfzehn Minuten.
example_en: The bus comes in fifteen minutes.

example_de: Es gibt sechzehn Bundesländer in Deutschland.
example_en: There are sixteen federal states in Germany.

example_de: Mit achtzehn darf man Auto fahren.
example_en: At eighteen you are allowed to drive.

example_de: Sie ist fast neunzig Jahre alt.
example_en: She is almost ninety years old.
I live on the second floor.
Take the fourth door on the left.

usage_notes: Used to express resignation or obviousness.

example_de: Eigentlich wollte ich ins Kino gehen.
example_en: Actually, I wanted to go to the cinema.

example_de: Du bist der Einzige, der mir helfen kann.
example_en: You are the only one who can help me.

example_de: Sie hat das Projekt erfolgreich abgeschlossen.
Wir haben das Projekt gemeinsam gemacht.

example_en: I am curious what will happen.

example_de: Gestern Abend waren wir im Theater.
example_en: Yesterday evening we were at the theater.
We have to get up early tomorrow morning.
That will take an hour at most.
Hopefully the weather will get better.

example_de: Inzwischen habe ich meine Meinung geändert.
example_en: In the meantime I have changed my opinion.
Something or other isn't right here.
Please only one person at a time.

english_translation: by no means, not at all
example_en: That is by no means acceptable.
He jumped headfirst into the water.

example_de: Wir mussten den Plan kurzfristig ändern.
example_en: We had to change the plan at short notice.

example_de: Langfristig ist das eine gute Investition.
example_en: In the long term, that is a good investment.
Mostly, I drink coffee in the morning.
We must talk with each other.
I met her the other day.

example_de: Notfalls können wir ein Taxi nehmen.
example_en: If necessary, we can take a taxi.

example_de: Wir müssen quer durch die Stadt fahren.
example_en: We have to drive across the city.

example_de: Seitdem habe ich nichts mehr von ihm gehört.
example_en: Since then I haven't heard from him.

usage_notes: Also used to mean 'even': `Selbst ich weiß das.`

example_de: Er hat sogar mein Geschenk vergessen.

example_en: We'll see each other the day after tomorrow.
I arrived the day before yesterday.
What do you need that for?
First of all, I would like to introduce myself.

example_de: Das habe ich noch nie zuvor gesehen.
example_en: I have never seen that before.

example_de: Er ist zwar reich, aber nicht glücklich.
example_en: Admittedly he is rich, but not happy.

example_de: Ich treffe ihn heute bzw. morgen.
example_en: I'm meeting him today, or rather tomorrow.

example_de: Man lernt, indem man Fehler macht.
Nachdem ich gegessen hatte, ging ich spazieren.
example_en: After I had eaten, I went for a walk.
usage_notes: Subordinating conjunction. Often involves past perfect tense.

example_de: Seit er hier arbeitet, ist er viel entspannter.
example_en: Since he has worked here, he is much more relaxed.

example_de: Ich rufe dich an, sobald ich zu Hause bin.
example_en: I'll call you as soon as I am home.

example_de: Solange du hier wohnst, gelten meine Regeln.
example_en: As long as you live here, my rules apply.

usage_notes: As a particle, it adds emphasis or assumes shared knowledge.

example_en: That's just the way it is.
Aren't you coming? - Yes, I am!
usage_notes: Used to contradict a negative statement or question.

example_en: Don't worry, it'll be okay again.
usage_notes: As a particle, it can be reassuring.
